title: AI talent wars: Ex-OpenAI researcher joins Zuckerberg’s SuperIntelligence
description: Lucas Beyer, a recent Meta hire from OpenAI, refuted claims of a $100 million signing bonus, dismissing them as "fake news." This follows Sam Altman's suggestion of Meta's extravagant offers to lure talent. Meta's CTO criticized Altman's tactics as dishonest, highlighting the ongoing talent war and Meta's significant AI investments.

title: 'Warlords': Iran's top clerics issue 'fatwa' against Trump, Netanyahu
description: A top Iranian cleric, Grand Ayatollah Shirazi, has issued a fatwa against Trump and Netanyahu, urging global Muslim action. This follows a reported 12-day conflict where US and Israeli operations significantly damaged Iran's nuclear sites, leading to retaliatory missile strikes.

title: Techie locks self in Navi Mumbai flat for 3 years; how did he survive?
description: In Navi Mumbai, Anup Kumar Nair, a 55-year-old man, battled severe loneliness and depression, isolating himself in his flat for three years, relying solely on online food orders. Following a concerned tip, SEAL social workers intervened, discovering Nair in dire conditions, suffering from a leg infection and profound distrust after the loss of his family

title: 'Break legs': Bhubaneswar cop's order against protesters sparks row
description: A controversy erupted in Bhubaneswar after Additional Police Commissioner Narasingha Bhol was recorded instructing officers to 'break legs' of Congress protestors demonstrating near Chief Minister Mohan Charan Majhi's residence regarding the Puri stampede. Bhol allegedly offered rewards for such actions, sparking strong condemnation from Congress leaders like Yashir Nawaz, who claimed they were holding a peaceful rally.

title: No stretcher at Bijnor CHC: Injured sanitation worker made to lie on floor for X-ray
description: A sanitation worker in Bijnor, Ranjeet Kumar, was allegedly forced to lie on the floor for an X-ray at Kiratpur Community Health Centre after a garbage van overturned on him. The incident, captured in a video, sparked public outrage and prompted a probe by District Magistrate Jasjit Kaur.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens in red; BSE Sensex down 100 points
description: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red on Monday. While Nifty50 was near 25,600, BSE Sensex was down 100 points.

title: No space for GOP moderates in Trump era? What Tillis's exit reveals
description: Senator Thom Tillis announced his retirement in 2026 after voting against Trump's 'Big Beautiful Bill,' highlighting the increasing difficulty for moderate Republicans. Trump celebrated Tillis's departure, signaling a tightening grip on the GOP. With moderates retreating, the party faces a transformation, potentially limiting bipartisanship and independent thinking in the Senate.

title: Railways' three big steps for ticketing! New charting, Tatkal & more- Details
description: Indian Railways is set to introduce significant changes to its passenger reservation system, aiming to enhance passenger comfort. Key improvements include preparing reservation charts eight hours in advance, implementing verified user-only Tatkal ticket bookings with OTP authentication by July 2025, and launching a new passenger reservation system by December 2025.

title: 'Ek hi format se liya h bas': Jadeja’s reply as teammates tease him at WC anniversary party - Watch
description: Team India celebrated the one-year anniversary of their 2024 T20 World Cup victory in Birmingham, taking a break from Test match preparations. A video shared by the BCCI captured the team cutting a cake and reminiscing about their unbeaten run to the title. The players, including Bumrah, Pant and Jadeja, shared light-hearted moments and laughter, celebrating the unforgettable triumph.

title: 'Like absolute butter': Trump on US bombing Iranian nuke facilities
description: President Trump declared American airstrikes had obliterated Iran's nuclear ambitions, particularly at the Fordo facility, dismissing doubts about the strikes' effectiveness and intelligence leaks. He asserted Iran was close to nuclear weapon acquisition before the strikes crippled their program. Trump also hinted at expanding the Abraham Accords with more Arab nations.

title: Idaho shooting: 2 killed as sniper targets firefighters
description: In Idaho, a sniper ambush targeted firefighters battling a blaze on Canfield Mountain, resulting in the deaths of at least two individuals believed to be firefighters. The lone shooter was found dead, and authorities have stated that there is no further threat to the community. Governor Brad Little condemned the attack, urging prayers for the victims and their families.

title: Amarnath Yatra from July 3: Mock drills held at Yatri Niwas base camp
description: Security forces in Jammu and Kashmir are preparing for the Amarnath Yatra. A mock drill was conducted at Yatri Niwas. This drill tested emergency response for potential disasters. The first pilgrim batch will leave Jammu on July 2. Authorities are ensuring all facilities are ready. Security measures include increased surveillance and highway patrols.

title: Jasmin Brown glows in third trimester; expecting second baby with Cam Newton
description: Jasmin Brown, expecting her second child with Cam Newton, shares glimpses of her pregnancy journey with fans. She balances her public persona with a desire for privacy, keeping details about her family life under wraps. As her due date approaches, Jasmin continues to inspire with her positive outlook and authentic celebration of motherhood.

title: 'Have to get re-elected': Trump's veiled warning to Republicans amid big bill debate
description: US Senate is currently engaged in discussions regarding President Donald Trump's 'Big Beautiful bill'. Republican leaders are aiming for approval by July 4. The bill includes significant tax reductions and cuts to Medicaid and food stamps. Concerns arise over potential insurance coverage loss for millions of Americans. The House Speaker Mike Johnson is preparing for a possible vote next week.

title: Trade talks: Canada buckles under Trump pressure, revokes 'digital tax'
description: Trade talks between Canada and the United States have been revived after Canada agreed to rescind its planned tax on American technology firms. This decision followed President Trump's suspension of negotiations in response to the digital services tax, which he viewed as an attack on the US. Both countries aim to reach a trade agreement by July 21, 2025.

title: Cops fled to save themselves: Puri stampede eyewitnesses, survivors
description: A stampede at Gundicha Temple in Puri led to three deaths. Survivors accuse the police of prioritizing their safety over rescuing devotees. Eyewitnesses report inadequate crowd control measures. They mention trucks obstructing the area and slippery logs contributing to the chaos. A resident highlights the recurring failure in managing large crowds during festivals. The incident raises concerns about safety protocols.

title: 'Out’ with the old: Wimbledon embraces ELC, retires line judges after 148 years
description: Wimbledon 2025 marks the end of an era as line judges are permanently replaced by Electronic Line Calling (ELC), joining the US and Australian Opens. Once a signature sight with their sharp attire and stoic presence, line judges will now serve as “match assistants” and a shortened bunch will be on standby should the technology hit a snag.

title: Monsoon covers all of India, including Delhi-NCR, 9 days ahead of schedule
'He got little upset': Trump downplays Musk's outbursts on 'big bill'
description: Donald Trump and Elon Musk are clashing again over a Senate bill Musk calls a job-destroying "abomination." Trump acknowledged Musk's past support but criticized his recent behavior, including a tweet linking him to Jeffrey Epstein. Trump attributed Musk's anger to concerns about electric vehicle mandates, stating he doesn't want everyone forced to drive electric cars.

title: 'Intercepted intel' again questions impact of US strikes on Iran nuke sites
description: Intercepted Iranian communications suggest minimal damage to nuclear facilities following US military action, casting doubt on claims of complete obliteration. A leaked preliminary assessment indicates the strikes might only cause months of setback. Despite President Trump's assertion of total destruction, the White House maintains the Iranian nuclear weapons program is over, contesting reports of limited impact.

title: 'Babu Rao’ back: Paresh Rawal confirms Hera Pheri 3; says row with Akshay resolved
description: Paresh Rawal is officially back as Babu Bhaiya in Hera Pheri 3, resolving previous disputes and reuniting the beloved trio. He emphasized the importance of respecting the audience's love for the franchise and delivering a worthwhile film. With all issues settled, the team is focused on working together to create a hilarious and nostalgic blockbuster for the big screen.

title: Railways to now prepare reservation charts 8 hours before departure
IND vs ENG: ‘Chosen twice’ – Rishabh Pant shares emotional message
description: Rishabh Pant reflected on his journey, a year after India's T20 World Cup victory, acknowledging his second chance at life following a severe accident. Despite a duck in the final against South Africa, Pant's strategic pause in play, feigning knee pain, disrupted South Africa's momentum, a move Rohit Sharma initially believed was genuine concern for Pant's well-being.

title: 64.3% of population under social security net, up from 22% in 2016: Govt report
description: India has made substantial strides in social protection, expanding coverage from 22% in 2016 to 64.3% in 2025. Poverty has declined significantly, with a notable reduction in extreme poverty rates.

title: 'Body language says...': Taylor Swift & Travis Kelce’s NYC date decoded
description: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce recently captured attention in Manhattan. Their coordinated style and affection suggest a deep connection. Body language expert Judi James notes their 'prom-queen and king' aesthetic. Travis Kelce's style seems to mirror Swift's. His gestures indicate he takes the relationship seriously. Their body language suggests a couple in the early stages of romance.

title: Post Op Sindoor, India to fast-track launch of 52 defence surveillance satellites
description: India is accelerating its space surveillance capabilities following Operation Sindoor, planning to launch 52 dedicated military satellites by 2029, with the first launch expected next April. This initiative, costing Rs 26,968 crore, aims to enhance surveillance of China, Pakistan, and the Indian Ocean Region. The move is also a response to China's growing space capabilities and military advancements in space.

title: Pak army chief Munir spews venom again, reiterates support for Kashmir terrorists
'Kannappa' Box Office: Vishnu Manchu's film crosses Rs 23 crore in opening weekend
description: Vishnu Manchu's mythological film 'Kannappa' has enjoyed a successful opening weekend, grossing approximately Rs 23.75 crore in India. The Telugu version led in occupancy, while Tamil and Hindi versions also performed moderately well. The film, directed by Mukesh Kumar Singh, features star-studded cameos and has received mixed but generally positive reviews, marking a career-best opening for Vishnu Manchu.

title: Maharashtra scraps order making Hindi 3rd language in schools
Sudden drop in BP caused Shefali Jariwala's death, say cops
AI 171 crash probe looking at sabotage angle too: Minister
description: The investigation into the Air India AI 171 crash in Ahmedabad on June 12 is exploring all possibilities, including sabotage, according to Junior Civil Aviation Minister Murlidhar Mohol. The Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau (AAIB) is analyzing the black box data, recovered CVR and FDR, to determine the cause of the accident.

title: 4 days after Kolkata rape, cops seize hockey stick, clothing of suspects; collect DNA
description: Kolkata Police's SIT swiftly investigates the alleged gang-rape of a law student, collecting crucial DNA evidence and seizing clothing from the suspects' homes. CCTV footage corroborates the survivor's account, showing her being dragged back to the guard room.

title: ‘Sitaare Zameen Par’ Box Office: Film soars past Rs 120 crore
description: Aamir Khan's 'Sitaare Zameen Par,' a sports drama directed by R.S. Prasanna, is a box office hit, earning Rs 122.65 crore in ten days. The film received praise from Shashi Tharoor and President Droupadi Murmu at special screenings. It tells the heartwarming story of a basketball coach training players with special needs, starring Aamir Khan and Genelia D’Souza.

title: Shux 1st Indian to hold experiment on ISS, kicks off with muscle loss study
description: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla has initiated groundbreaking experiments on the ISS, marking India's advancement in space research. His Myogenesis study addresses muscle breakdown in microgravity, crucial for future space missions and Earth-based treatments. Alongside Shukla, the Ax-4 crew, including Commander Peggy Whitson, is conducting cancer research, potentially revealing insights into drug resistance and tumor behavior.

title: Stay vigilant to safeguard Constitution: PM on Emergency
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi commemorated the 50th anniversary of the Emergency, recalling it as a dark chapter and urging vigilance to protect the Constitution. He highlighted the unified opposition against the Emergency, citing former Prime Ministers Morarji Desai and Atal Bihari Vajpayee, along with Jagjivan Ram, who spoke against the atrocities and the importance of safeguarding democracy.

title: IND vs ENG: After Moeen, Birmingham's 'uncle Munir' is shaping careers of his grandkids
description: In Birmingham, Munir Ali, father of former England star Moeen Ali, now mentors a new cricketing generation — his grandkids. Known locally as “Uncle Munir,” he’s shaping young talents like Isaac Mohammed and Abu Baker with the same dedication that nurtured Moeen. From local parks to county dreams, Munir’s cricketing legacy continues to inspire Birmingham’s tight-knit cricket community.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Disappointed' - Ex-India cricketer questions ECB’s move
description: Farokh Engineer, a close friend of Mansur Ali Khan Pataudi, criticized the ECB's initial decision to rename the India-England Test series trophy, feeling the subsequent introduction of a winning captain's medal named after the Pataudi family was merely an afterthought.

title: ‘Cannot be one-hundred wonder’ —Manjrekar's stern message to senior India batter
description: India aims to rebound in the second Test against England. Sanjay Manjrekar highlights Rishabh Pant's potential to continue his form. He also emphasizes KL Rahul's need for consistent performance. Jasprit Bumrah may miss the match. Jofra Archer joins England's squad. India's top order must lead the fightback in challenging conditions. The second Test starts on July 2 in Birmingham.

title: Rohit celebrates T20 WC win anniversary, enjoys vacation with family – See photos
description: Fresh from retirement from Test cricket, former India captain Rohit Sharma is vacationing in Europe with his family. Reflecting on India's recent T20 World Cup victory, Sharma described lifting the trophy as the proudest moment of his career. He admitted to battling nerves before the final, a testament to the significance of ending India's 13-year wait for an ICC title.

title: IND vs ENG: All eyes on Jasprit Bumrah's workload
description: Ahead of the second Test against England, concerns linger over Jasprit Bumrah's workload. Despite enjoying a day off, speculation persists about his availability. It was pre-decided in March that Bumrah would only play three Tests in England, according to Soham Desai. Workload management involves objective data from devices and subjective observation of the bowler's behavior.

title: ‘Not his job to bat’ – Steve Smith takes a dig at former Australia cricketer
description: Australian vice-captain Steve Smith has defended batting coach Michael Di Venuto against criticism from Ian Healy, who suggested a decline in batting performance since 2021. Smith dismissed Healy's claims, emphasizing Di Venuto's hard work and knowledge.

title: MLC 2025: Faf du Plessis creates history with this record for TSK
description: Faf du Plessis creates history in Major League Cricket. He scores his third century. He leads Texas Super Kings to a big total against MI New York. Texas Super Kings scores 223 for 4. Du Plessis remains unbeaten on 103 off 53 balls. Donovan Ferreira also contributes with a quickfire 53. Texas Super Kings aims for a strong playoff run.

title: MLC 2025: Faf du Plessis stars as Texas Super Kings outgun MI New York
description: Faf du Plessis's explosive unbeaten century propelled Texas Super Kings to a dominant 39-run victory over MI New York in a high-scoring Major League Cricket 2025 encounter. Texas Super Kings posted a formidable 223 for 4, with Donovan Ferreira's rapid half-century further boosting their total.

title: USA Cricket board faces ICC pressure amid looming suspension threat
description: Despite repeated warnings to fix governance issues, little or no progress has been made; Governing body expects USAC directors to resign ahead of annual conference or face sanctions

title: IND vs ENG: 'Doesn't get bigger ...' - ABD questions Bumrah's workload plan
description: AB de Villiers has expressed his surprise at reports suggesting Jasprit Bumrah will be rested for some of the ongoing Test series against England. De Villiers questioned the decision, drawing parallels to how South Africa managed Dale Steyn's workload, prioritising his availability for crucial Test matches.

title: 'Not proactive' - Shubman Gill's captaincy lambasted by former ENG cricketer
description: Shubman Gill's captaincy is under scrutiny following India's dramatic Test defeat in Leeds, despite dominating earlier phases of the match. Critics like David Lloyd point to tactical inexperience, while Alastair Cook urges patience, drawing parallels with Ben Stokes' initial leadership challenges.

title: MLC: Unmukt Chand is LAKR's lone bright spot, but will USA Cricket notice?
description: After struggling in the first two Major League Cricket (MLC) seasons, Unmukt Chand has finally found his feet in the US, where he moved to live his ultimate dream: “to play for the US national team.” The right-handed batter has scored 243 runs in seven innings and is sixth on the list of top run-getters in the ongoing MLC 2025.

title: Tragedy! Cricketer dies of heart attack moments after hitting a six - Video
description: In a tragic incident in Firozpur, cricketer Harjeet Singh died on the field after hitting a six. He collapsed moments later, suffering a fatal heart attack. Despite immediate CPR efforts by teammates, he was declared dead at the scene. This incident follows a similar tragedy in Pune earlier this year, raising concerns about cardiac incidents among athletes.

title: Sanjay Manjrekar warns KL Rahul ahead of 2nd Test - 'Can't be a one-hundred wonder'
description: Sanjay Manjrekar urges KL Rahul to display consistent Test performances as he steps into a senior role after Virat Kohli's and Rohit Sharma's retirements. While the former India star is confident of Rishabh Pant he wants KL Rahul to step up and maintain his form that he showed in the 1st Test.

title: 'Still a work in progress': Mandhana reflects on T20I ton, eyes more big scores
description: Smriti Mandhana celebrated her maiden T20I century, a remarkable 112, while captaining India against England at Trent Bridge, securing a 97-run victory. She acknowledged the format's challenges for her natural game and her ongoing efforts to enhance power-hitting. Mandhana also expressed confidence in fellow opener Shafali Verma's potential for a significant innings soon.

title: ZIM vs SA: South Africa in command despite Sean Williams’ century, lead by 216 at stumps
description: Sean Williams's brilliant century was the highlight for Zimbabwe, who were otherwise struggling against South Africa's strong bowling attack. South Africa, after declaring at 418/9, took a commanding first-innings lead. By the end of Day 2, they extended their lead to 216, closing at 49/1, firmly in control of the Test match.

title: 'GF hogi, wife hogi': Sanjana recalls first meeting; Bumrah reacts, 'What logic is that?'
description: Jasprit Bumrah and Sanjana Ganesan humorously recounted their initial encounter during the 2019 World Cup, where Sanjana mistakenly believed Bumrah was avoiding her due to a presumed girlfriend or wife. Bumrah clarified that his shy nature led to the initial awkwardness. Eventually, they connected, married in 2021, and welcomed their son in 2023.

title: Controversial West African activist Kemi Seba detained in Paris
description: Kemi Seba, a controversial African activist known for his virulent anti-Western stance, has been arrested in Paris, a source close to the case told AFP Tuesday.

title: France’s new health pass rules raise questions as many scramble to adapt
description: While the extension of France’s health pass and other new anti-Covid 19 measures announced by President Emmanuel Macron Monday night are yet to be hammered out in detail, what’s certain is that a full-throttled return to a normal life of frequenting café terraces, restaurants, cinemas, theatres and other culture and leisure activities will now hinge on having a pass sanitaire (or health pass).

title: Daughter loses legal case in bitter Asterix family feud
description: A long-running family feud between Asterix co-creator Albert Uderzo and his daughter took a new twist on Tuesday after judges dismissed a claim by Sylvie Uderzo that her father was mentally frail and being exploited.

title: Sarkozy’s legal woes roll on despite court ruling
description: A probe into claims Nicolas Sarkozy received illegal funding for his successful 2007 presidential campaign has been dropped. But as he considers a political comeback, several other cases threaten serious damage to his reputation.

title: African troops march with French for Bastille Day
description: The famed military parade for Bastille Day on Paris’s Champs-Elysées Sunday featured African troops who assisted France in its Mali operation against Islamist rebels. However, some have criticised the African presence as a sign of neo-colonial ties.

title: French conservatives defeat far right in tight by-election
description: France’s conservative UMP party narrowly defeated the far-right National Front in a by-election on Sunday, with candidate Jean-Louis Costes (pictured) winning the seat vacated by disgraced Socialist MP Jérôme Cahuzac following a tax evasion scandal.

title: Record number of women and minorities in new French parliament
description: With more women and members of foreign descent than any previous National Assembly, France's newly-elected parliament has moved a step closer to mirroring French society, even as ethnic-minority groups demand more diversity in politics.

title: New poll gives Sarkozy first round election lead
description: An opinion poll for the first time Tuesday put French President Nicolas Sarkozy ahead of Socialist rival François Hollande for the April 22 first round of presidential elections but showed Hollande would win a run-off vote on May 6.

title: Socialist candidate drums up support in French tropics
description: Socialist presidential hopeful Francois Hollande and President Nicolas Sarkozy will both visit French overseas regions Martinique, Guadeloupe, and French Guiana in upcoming weeks, with Hollande kicking off the charm offensive first.

title: Violent protests have ‘weakened unions’ in retirement battle
description: As the French government gets closer to signing a law that will raise the retirement age in France from 60 to 62, a leading French labour expert says violent clashes between youths and police have undermined the unions’ position.

title: Left-wing alliance trumps Sarkozy’s party in regional polls
description: The ruling UMP party of President Nicolas Sarkozy experienced a wipeout in the second round of France’s regional elections, with the Socialists and their left-wing allies winning in all but one of mainland France's 22 regions.

title: France bans smoking in beaches, parks and bus shelters from Sunday
description: A ban on smoking in certain public spaces including beaches, parks, bus shelters and public gardens comes into effect in France from Sunday, the government said.

title: Top contemporary French artist Christian Boltanski dies aged 76
description: Christian Boltanski, one of France's top contemporary artists whose multimedia works probed the meaning of mortality and memory, has died aged 76, a former museum director told AFP on Sunday.

title: ‘France is your homeland’, Hollande tells French Jews
description: French President François Hollande announced tough new measures to combat anti-Semitism on Tuesday as he marked the 70th anniversary of the liberation of the Auschwitz death camp with a visit to Paris's Holocaust memorial.

title: World leaders arrive in France for D-Day celebrations
description: Seventy years after the first Allied planes set off for the World War II invasion of Normandy, world leaders descended on France Thursday to remember the dead and commemorate D-Day in two days of memorial celebrations.

title: French court drops probe into Sarkozy campaign cash
description: A French court on Monday dropped a formal investigation into illegal campaign financing by former president Nicolas Sarkozy, who had been under investigation since March for allegedly accepting funds from L'Oréal heiress Liliane Bettencourt.

title: US consultant admits role in France's 'Karachi affair'
description: A US political consultant has admitted being paid by an intermediary in 1994 arms sales for advising the campaign of French presidential hopeful Édouard Balladur. The admission may shed new light on the scandal known as the “Karachi affair”.

title: French far-right shames Socialists in by-election
description: The far-right National Front has moved on to the second round of a parliamentary by-election to replace disgraced former MP Jérôme Cahuzac. The victory is an embarrassing blow to the Socialist government of President François Hollande.

title: Greens secure ‘historic’ gains in French parliamentary poll
description: France’s Green party won 17 seats in the country’s general election Sunday, an unprecedented score that makes it prominent enough to form its own parliamentary group, giving it more clout in political decision-making.

title: 'Lust’ is not a crime, say Strauss-Kahn lawyers
description: Dominique Strauss-Kahn’s lawyers have said their client, placed under formal investigation Monday for alleged involvement in a prostitution ring, was being hounded for “the offence of lust” which is “not forbidden in the penal code”.

title: Who will be France’s next first lady, or gentleman?
description: A singer, a journalist, a housewife or a plasterer’s son: who will move into the Elysée Palace in May, and can candidates count on their partners to help them get there? FRANCE 24 takes a look at who might be France’s next first lady… or gentleman.

title: Who's on strike in France?
description: Numerous industry sectors have joined the growing strikes against French President Nicolas Sarkozy’s unpopular pension reforms. Here are the sectors causing the most disruption.

title: Roma expulsion orders called into question by lawyers
description: In the Parisian suburb of Montreuil, 14 Roma men were ordered to leave French territory after a police roundup in August. Lawyers say their case proves the government is behind a discriminatory and illegal policy of expulsions.

title: Left-leaning parties form alliance to keep lead in second round
description: Ahead of a March 21 run-off vote, France’s Socialists allied with the Greens and other left leaning parties in a deal struck on Tuesday following the Socialists’ first-place showing in round one of regional elections.

title: France steps closer to adding consent to legal definition of rape
description: The French Senate has passed a bill that would change the legal definition of rape to add a clear reference to consent, bringing the country in line with several European neighbours. A joint committee of senators and lower-house MPs is now expected to draft a joint text prior to its final adoption.

title: In search for French heroes, Macron blunders – again
description: France’s embattled leader saw a week of World War I commemorations as a chance to reconnect with the French and highlight the danger of nationalism. Instead, his comments about Marshal Pétain gave further evidence of his tendency to shock and dismay.

title: France makes 323 arrests since start of Euro 2016 championship
description: French police have made 323 arrests since the start of the European Championships, the interior ministry said on Thursday, as Europe's showcase football event continues to be marred by violence.

title: Sarkozy ensnared in Bettencourt scandal
description: Former president Nicolas Sarkozy will remain under formal investigation in a case involving suspected illegal campaign donations by France’s richest woman, Liliane Bettencourt, after judges dismissed a motion to throw out a key medical report.

title: French ministers disclose personal wealth for first time
description: French authorities published the personal wealth of ministers on the government website on Monday in a bid to restore public confidence following a tax-evasion scandal which led to the resignation of former budget minister Jérôme Cahuzac.

title: Socialists free to push through reform agenda
description: The resounding Socialist Party victory in Sunday's parliamentary elections will allow new French President François Hollande to follow through with promised economic reforms to stimulate growth across Europe, a senior minister said Monday.

title: Winter pressure bad as height of pandemic, NHS says
description: More than 5,400 patients a day are in hospital with flu, as delays in A&E and for ambulances mount.

title: Pound falls to lowest in over a year after UK borrowing costs rise
description: Economists have warned the rise could mean further tax hikes or spending cuts by the government.

title: Fresh weather warnings for ice across UK
description: Temperatures could fall as low as -16C with travel disruption likely to road and rail services.

title: People smugglers to have finances targeted with new sanctions
description: The planned measures will target the finances of illegal smuggling networks, the Home Office says.

title: Tractor protest as minister pledges farmers 'new deal'
description: The government says its policies will boost food production and clear planning red tape for farmers.

title: Teenager dies after bus station stabbing
description: A murder investigation begins and parts of a town centre are cordoned off after a 17-year-old dies.

title: Teaching union to ballot members over pay offer
description: The National Education Union will vote on whether to accept the government’s pay recommendation.

title: Lloyds, Halifax and Bank of Scotland to share branches
description: The move is intended to make it easier for people to access banking services, but some warn it will lead to more branch closures.

title: Jeremy Hunt apologises to Letby victims' families
description: The former health secretary has been giving evidence at the Thirlwall Inquiry into the nurse's crimes.

title: Truss legal threat to PM over claim she crashed economy
description: No 10 insists millions of people share Sir Keir's view of the Truss government's economic record.

title: Some councils ordered to increase home building by 400%, new BBC tracker shows
description: The postcode lookup allows anyone in England to monitor new home-building targets in their area.

title: Mick Lynch announces retirement as head of RMT
description: Mr Lynch steered the union through fierce pay strikes in 2022 and 2023 before securing a new deal.

title: Man told he can't recover £598m of Bitcoin from tip
description: James Howells tried to sue a council for access to the site or get £495m in compensation.

title: Rugby star Stuart Hogg sentenced for domestic abuse
description: The former Scotland captain previously admitted acting in an abusive manner towards his estranged wife.

title: Russell Brand fined after being caught speeding
description: The actor and comedian admits doing 95mph on a motorway and 37mph in a 30mph zone.

title: William wishes 'incredible' wife Kate happy birthday
description: The personal message from the Prince of Wales accompanies a previously unseen picture of Catherine.

title: Lynx captured after illegal release in Highlands
description: Conservation experts set traps to humanely capture the two animals, spotted near Kingussie on Wednesday.

title: Half of English county councils set to ask to delay elections
description: The councils want to delay votes to explore new plans to redesign local government in England.

title: Food prices 'not going anywhere but up', say retailers
description: Festive food sales jumped but the retailer is concerned about the British economy.

title: Lauren Laverne steps down from 6 Music breakfast show
description: The star has been absent from the radio station since August while receiving treatment for cancer.

title: Mother 'not surprised' son killed on London bus
description: Kelyan Bokassa was groomed by gangs from the age of six years old, his mother Mary Bokassa said.

title: Grooming still happening in Oxford, ex-investigator says
description: Simon Morton says perpetrators are operating in plain sight and the "guys we couldn't catch are still out there".

title: Fake Aldi on Google Maps wreaks 'havoc' on village
description: Shoppers end up empty handed after driving to a rural village hoping to buy their bread and milk.

title: The latest forecast covering the UK
description: BBC weather presenter Darren Bett has the latest UK forecast for Tuesday.

title: Aerial footage shows severe flooding in Leicestershire
description: Large swathes of the Leicestershire countryside have been inundated by floodwater.

title: 'My drive is reviving the culture of stone lifting'
description: A Cumbria farmer is on a mission to track down England's ancient lifting stones.

title: Explosion caught on doorbell camera
description: Residents in the village were shocked after hearing a very loud bang and seeing a large orange flame.

title: The road plagued by works for 23 years
description: The roadworks have been in place since before wifi, smartphones and social media.

title: The 20 child abuse inquiry proposals - what has happened so far?
description: A seven-year inquiry into the sexual abuse of children was published in 2022 - what has happened since?

title: Lammy challenges Trump's rhetoric days before White House return
description: The foreign secretary talks up UK-US relations - but clear divisions with the incoming president remain.

title: Why are UK borrowing costs rising and what does it mean for me?
description: Government borrowing costs have hit their highest level for several years - what does it mean for you?

title: Market trouble threatens Labour's economic plans
description: Chancellor Rachel Reeves may have to choose between tax rises and spending cuts, writes Henry Zeffman.

title: 'I changed jobs, work nights, and we still can't afford a home'
description: Struggling families say they can only dream of having their own home, as the BBC tracks government housebuilding targets.

title: Clear racism at Al Fayed's Harrods, former staff tell BBC
description: Staff of "certain races" would leave shop floor before he toured the store, BBC told.

title: 'You feel guilty for wanting a donated organ'
description: Claire, whose baby had a liver transplant, says people should be clear if they want to donate their organs.

title: Surprise fall in inflation boosts interest rate cut hopes
description: Inflation falls for the first time in three months, sparking expectations rates may be cut to 4.5% in February.
